alert.note: Alert for Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 4:13AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Locally heavy downpours will impact portions of east central Windham, Norfolk, central Essex, Middlesex, Barnstable, Bristol, Suffolk, eastern Worcester, Plymouth, Bristol, northeastern Washington, Kent and Providence Counties through 515 AM EST... At 411 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of heavy downpours over Stoughton, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. In addition, there could be localized icy road conditions. Even as air temperatures rise above freezing, ground temperatures will be slow to rise above freezing until after daybreak due to the recent stretch of cold weather. Locations impacted include... Boston, Worcester, Providence, Lowell, Cambridge, New Bedford, Brockton, Quincy, Lynn, Fall River, Newton, Warwick, Cranston, Lawrence, Somerville, Pawtucket, Framingham, Waltham, Malden and Brookline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
